2021-08-04.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2021-08-04.summary: Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free classical concerts in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion.

2021-08-06.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2021-08-06.summary: Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free classical concerts in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion.

2021-08-06.name: River City Days
2021-08-06.summary: In this Mississippi River town, there's music, food and games in Bay Point Park and an arts show in Levee             Park. The parade is at 1 p.m. Sunday.

2021-08-06.name: Blues on the Chippewa
2021-08-06.summary: Just up the Chippewa River from Lake Pepin, this free blues festival in Memorial Park features 16 bands.

2021-08-06.name: Tall Timber Days
2021-08-06.summary: In this longtime logging town, there will be lumberjack shows, chainsaw carving, music and a parade Sunday.

2021-08-07.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2021-08-07.summary: Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free classical concerts in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion.

2021-08-07.summary: In this longtime logging town, there will be lumberjack shows, chainsaw carving, music and a parade Sunday.

2021-08-07.name: Buffalo Bill Days
2021-08-07.summary: Ride the Root River State Trail, then enjoy music, kids' games, sports tournaments, fireworks and a parade on Sunday.

2021-08-11.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2021-08-11.summary: Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free classical concerts in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion.

2021-08-13.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2021-08-13.summary: Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free classical concerts in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion.

2021-08-13.name: Iowa Arts Festival
2021-08-13.summary: This free downtown festival features an art show, a Global Village, a Culinary Row and music and dance. Sunday is Children's Day, with 10 booths of hands-on activities.

2021-08-13.name: Burger Fest
2021-08-13.summary: This town west of Green Bay calls itself Home of the Hamburger, based  on a local 15-year-old who put ground-beef patties in a bun, called  them hamburgers and sold them at the Seymour Fair in 1885.

2021-08-13.name: Tall Tales Music Festival
2021-08-13.summary: This free festival celebrates storytelling through music, with performances by national as well as regional musicians. In addition, workshops are offered for people of all ages.

2021-08-14.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2021-08-14.summary: Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free classical concerts in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion.

2021-08-14.name: Iowa Arts Festival
2021-08-14.summary: This free downtown festival features an art show, a Global Village, a Culinary Row and music and dance. Sunday is Children's Day, with 10 booths of hands-on activities.

2021-08-14.name: Burger Fest
2021-08-14.summary: This town west of Green Bay calls itself Home of the Hamburger, based  on a local 15-year-old who put ground-beef patties in a bun, called  them hamburgers and sold them at the Seymour Fair in 1885.

2021-08-14.summary: This free festival celebrates storytelling through music, with performances by national as well as regional musicians. In addition, workshops are offered for people of all ages.

2021-08-14.name: IndiaFest
2021-08-14.summary: On the State Capitol grounds, watch Bollywood dance and a parade of cultures, eat East Indian food, get your hands painted with henna and learn the principles of cricket and yoga.

2021-08-18.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2021-08-18.summary: Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free classical concerts in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion.

2021-08-20.name: Ki-Chi-Saga Days
2021-08-20.summary: The fest in this town just north of St. Paul features an Old World  market, sandcastle and skateboard contests, Swedish dancers, a horn  hunt, fireworks Saturday and a parade on Sunday.

2021-08-20.name: Sweet Corn Festival
2021-08-20.summary: A Thursday-night parade kicks off this festival just north of Madison, and there's also a craft fair, car show, tractor pull, music, carnival rides and, on Saturday and Sunday, literally tons of steamed sweet corn.

2021-08-20.name: Blues, Brews & BBQ
2021-08-20.summary: Listen to the blues and eat barbecued foods in Petersen Park on McCollum Lake.

2021-08-21.summary: Listen to the blues and eat barbecued foods in Petersen Park on McCollum Lake.

2021-08-21.name: Art & Chalk Fest
2021-08-21.summary: Outside the Museum of Wisconsin Art, there will be chalk-art workshops for kids, artist demonstrations, balloon art, food, a beer garden, and music all day. Museum admission is free.

2021-08-21.name: HarborPark Jazz & Blues Festival
2021-08-21.summary: This free festival is in the lakefront Celebration Place.

2021-08-15.name: Iowa Arts Festival
2021-08-15.summary: This free downtown festival features an art show, a Global Village, a Culinary Row and music and dance. Sunday is Children's Day, with 10 booths of hands-on activities.

2021-08-27.name: HarborFest
2021-08-27.summary: This Lake Superior town celebrates with rock and blues music, a classic car and  motorcycle show, a luge run and inflatables for kids.
